pages.text: Even engineers can find use in some magic here and there.
Placing White Candles near your Enchanting Table will increase the chance of finding an $(bold)Unbreaking$() piece.
Placing Orange Candles near your Enchanting Table will increase the chance of finding a $(bold)Fire Protection$() piece.
Placing Magenta Candles near your Enchanting Table will increase the chance of finding a $(bold)Knockback$() or $(bold)Punch$() piece.
Placing Light Blue Candles near your Enchanting Table will increase the chance of finding a $(bold)Feather Falling$() or $(bold)Stepping$() piece.
Placing Yellow Candles near your Enchanting Table will increase the chance of finding a $(bold)Looting$(), $(bold)Fortune$(), or $(bold)Luck of the Sea$() piece.
Placing Lime Candles near your Enchanting Table will increase the chance of finding a $(bold)Blast Protection$() piece.
Placing Pink Candles near your Enchanting Table will increase the chance of finding a $(bold)Silk Touch$() or $(bold)Channeling$() piece.
Placing Gray Candles near your Enchanting Table will increase the chance of finding a $(bold)Bane of Arthropods$() piece.
Placing Light Blue Candles near your Enchanting Table will increase the chance of finding a $(bold)Sweeping Edge$(), $(bold)Multishot$(), or $(bold)Backstabbing$() piece.

Placing Blue Candles near your Enchanting Table will increase the chance of finding a $(bold)Efficiency$(), $(bold)Sharpness$(), $(bold)Lure$(), $(bold)Power$(), $(bold)Impaling$(), or $(bold)Quick Charge$() piece.
Placing Brown Candles near your Enchanting Table will increase the chance of finding an $(bold)Aqua Affinity, $(bold)Depth Strider$(), or $(bold)Riptide$() piece.
Placing Green Candles near your Enchanting Table will increase the chance of finding a $(bold)Thorns$() or $(bold)Piercing$() piece.
Placing Red Candles near your Enchanting Table will increase the chance of finding a $(bold)Fire Aspect$() or $(bold)Flame$() piece.
Placing Black Candles near your Enchanting Table will increase the chance of finding a $(bold)Smite$(), $(bold)Projectile Protection$(), or $(bold)Rebound$() piece.
